title: Érick Vallecillo
text:
Érick Cecilio Vallecillo Paguada (born January 29, 1980) is a Honduran <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28football%29">defender</a>, who currently plays for USA fourth tier-side <a href="Miami%20United%20F.C.">Miami United</a>.
Club career.
Vallecillo started his career at <a href="Real%20C.D.%20Espa%C3%B1a">Real España</a> with whom he spent the majority of his career. He moved abroad to play the 2011 Clausura in Guatemala with <a href="C.S.D.%20Municipal">Municipal</a>. In summer 2011 he returned home and joined <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Choloma">Atlético Choloma</a> but he was released by the club after the 2011 Apertura. In 2012, he played in the Copa Latina for Blue Stars Honduras.
In 2013, he joined compatriot <a href="Sa%C3%BAl%20Mart%C3%ADnez">Saúl Martínez</a> at newly formed <a href="Miami%20United%20F.C.">Miami United</a> of the <a href="National%20Premier%20Soccer%20League">National Premier Soccer League</a>.
International career.
Vallecillo played at the <a href="1999%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">1999 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> in <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a> and made his senior debut for <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a> in an April <a href="2003%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup%20qualification">2003 CONCACAF Gold Cup qualification</a> match against <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%20national%20football%20team">Trinidad & Tobago</a> and has earned a total of 34 caps, scoring no goals. He has represented his country in 1 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> match and played at the <a href="2005%20UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">2005</a> and <a href="2007%20UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">2007 UNCAF Nations Cup</a>s as well as at the <a href="2003%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2003</a>, <a href="2005%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2005</a> and <a href="2007%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2007 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>s.
His final international was an August 2007 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a>.
Personal life.
His brother, <a href="Orlin%20Vallecillo">Orlin Vallecillo</a>, also plays for <a href="Real%20Espa%C3%B1a">Real España</a>. Married to gladiz Carolina sandoval
